title:
Asymptotic stability of delayed complex balanced reaction networks with
  non-mass action kinetics
abstract:
We consider delayed chemical reaction networks with generalized kinetics of
product form and show that complex balancing implies that within each positive
stoichiometric compatibility class there is a unique positive equilibrium that
is locally asymptotically stable relative to its class. The main tools of the
proofs are respectively a version of the well-known classical logarithmic
Lyapunov function applied to kinetic systems and its generalization to the
delayed case as a Lyapunov-Krasovskii functional. Finally, we demonstrate our
results through illustrative examples.
